intro: Pteropogon spicatus, commonly known as the spiny pteropogon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear yellowish-white flowers, which are typically pollinated by insects. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitats.
